task.title: Process a Guided Adjustment Work Location Update
task.shortdesc: Create a Guided Adjustment to update the work location for a single employee and process the checks for that employee that span a year. Checks can span either the current year or the immediate prior year.

step.cmd: From the Manage Adjustments page, select Add.
From the Select Adjustment Type pane, select Create Guided Adjustment.

image.alt: Select Adjustment Type dialog with the Create Guided Adjustment button highlighted

step.cmd: From the Select Employee page, select the employee.
From the Create Guided Adjustments page, in the Year drop-down list, select the current year or the immediate prior year and then select Search.
step.stepresult: A count of the number of available checks is displayed. The grid populates with all of the employee's checks for the selected year. Select the Document Number link for the check to view the non-editable data in the Pay Data Entry screen, as needed.

step.cmd:
In the Employee details area:
At the From drop-down list, select the location from where you want to move wages and taxes. This selection filters the list of checks to display only checks paid from that work location.The From list shows only work locations the employee was paid from.
At the To drop-down list, select the location where you want to move your wages and taxes.
To mark the new work location as the primary work location, select the Primary Location box, as needed.
All work locations assigned to that employee are available for selection.
A Short-Term Disability Insurance (SDI) selection is available if the state selected in the To field provides disability insurance. Select this option to assign and save that disability insurance to the employee. Create Guided Adjustment screen with From, To, and Primary selections
In the grid, select the checks to apply the work location change, and then select Apply.

image.alt: Example showing selected checks to applying Work Location Guided Adjustment

info.note: You can select Save to save the session with all the current selections.

step.cmd: In the Confirm Adjustment dialog box, review the information.
From the Reason for Adjustment drop-down list, select a reason.
step.info: You can configure additional Reasons for Adjustments in the Adjustment Reasons business rule.

step.cmd: From the Date Identified field, select the date that the required correction was discovered.
Select Confirm to apply the adjustment.

image.alt: Confirm Adjustment dialog example with required fields completed

ul.li: Confirming the adjustment does not post the adjusted checks.
Guided adjustments reconcile wages and taxes for the entire year. Where an adjustment affects a wage or tax limit, guided adjustments identify and flag subsequently impacted checks with an "i" icon.

step.stepresult: From the Process Guided Adjustment page, all selected and subsequently impacted checks are displayed. Select the document number link to review and edit the taxes, as needed.Example of Guided Adjustment resulting in subsequently impacted checks
